Questions.QuestionText: What is the formula used to calculate the width for operating drapery? Don't forget to complete the required drawing with measurements!
Questions.AnswerText:
72" window + 4" past + 3" trim + 3" trim + 4" past + 4" overlap in the middle to let the treatment relax and not see a gap.
(Take the answer from the above calculation x 2 + 6 + 6 selvage (for a pair of panels)) / 54" fabric width.
Note: Remember, you cannot have part of a cut so you need 4 cuts.

Questions.QuestionText: Using the calculations from question 1, what are the two final values?.
What is the correct length of the rod you will need? Show the calculation and the answer.
Questions.AnswerText: 4" past + 3" trim + 72" window + 3" trim + 4" past = 86" rod which equals 7.16 rod. Note: Do NOT include overlap here!

Questions.QuestionText: Now calculate the length. What are the formulas you use to do this? Include the answers in your work.
Questions.AnswerText:
• 8' ceiling = 96". Space between glass and ceiling = 12" (add 3" trim around window) = 9" between trim and ceiling
  • Subtract 6" above trim = 3" from ceiling
  • Treatment hangs 6" above the trim, therefore 96" ceiling height - 3" from ceiling = 93"
  • 93" + 1" for grommet style over rod = "94"
  • Minus ½" above floor = 94" - ½ from floor - 93.5" finished length
  • Plus 16 hem and header = 109.5" which equalsthe order/purchase length per cut
  • Number of cuts x order length: 4 x 109.5" / 36" in a yard = 12.16 yards.
  • Round up to 12 ¼ – 12 ½ yards to order/purchase
